poem:
### Game Selection

So many titles  
flicker,  
a cascade of pixels—  
untouched  
in the backlog.  
Swipe right on the future,  
with thumbs poised,  
desiring an escape  
among the clutter  
of digital promises.  
New stories bubble up  
like air in a tank,  
waiting  
for the touch  
that grants them life,  
while others sink,  
unseen,  
in a sea of potential.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Looking for something new to spice up your game play? The Tinder of games is here As any adult who loves video games knows, there are simply too many of them – 19,000 games were released in 2024 on PC games storefront Steam alone, not counting all the playable delights on consoles and smartphones. Most of us have backlogs of unplayed classics that make us feel guilty about buying newer games. Finding things that are". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
